results.title: Commonsense afoot!
results.brief_description: Opens with a newspaper summary of the accident rate. Deals with the rules for pedestrian traffic, both on the footpath and on the road; the use of school crossings; the correct way of alighting from cars, trains, and buses; the advisability of walking against the traffic on country roads.

results.title: Comedy greats: Peter Cooke & Dudley Moore
results.brief_description: This film is a collection of some of the infectious comic skits conceived and performed by Peter Cook and Dudley Moore that were to influence and inspire a generation of performers with their fresh and innovative style. Collected from their landmark 60’s TV show, “Not only but also”, this video samples some of the best, to include; Bo Dudley, The Leaping Nuns, Roger and Sir discussing ‘the opposite number and how Roger came to be’, the moving life story of acclaimed Finnish film star of the 30’s Bargo (aka Anna Nigma), Pete and Dud discussing how they’ve rejected a host of screen sirens from Betty Grable to Anna Magnani. Including many other skits, they particularly enjoy poking fun at the film industry and the art world in general. Their repartee and affection for each other is obvious, especially when together they employ a number of techniques to prevent themselves from laughing, including stuffing their mouths with food.

results.title: Come September
results.creator_credit: Robert Rothols and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: This film was made during the Centenary Royal Show in 1972, to commemorate 100 years of traditional partnership between the Department of Agriculture and the Royal Agriculture Society in the Royal Show. Using locations sound and music only, the film aims to give an impression of the contrasting facets of the Melbourne Show, and how it sets out to attract a wide range of people, mainly from urban areas.

results.title: Come out fighting
results.brief_description: Low budget realistic work made with assistance from the Experimental Film and Television Fund. Adapted from a play by Harry Martin, it presents a crisis in the life of an Aboriginal boxer in the face of conflicting demands from Aboriginal friends, fight promoters and students campaigning for Aboriginal rights. Cast includes Michael Karpaney, Cliff Neale, Bethany Lee, Peter Green, Bob Horsfall, Peter Adams, Brian Torrens.

results.title: Combat fatigue: insomnia
results.brief_description: Describes one of the milder effects of combat fatigue in its portrayal of one sailor’s inability to sleep. Solution is offered through some simple relaxation techniques. Stars Dick York (famed for “Bewitched” TV series, etc).

results.title: Columbian Gold Sweat of the Sun
results.brief_description: An introduction to the country and civilisation that produced the intricate gold ornaments and artefacts shown in the recent Columbian Gold Exhibition. Historical maps and lithographs intercut with present day living conditions explain the disastrous effects of European domination of the Indians, and explains why, with so little of their complex and powerful civilisation left, these gold objects remain the Indian’s most refined cultural expression

constellations_other.name: Kaleidoscopic colour: Chromotrope
constellations_other.description: A focus on distinctive and innovative examples of pattern, colour and movement.

results.description: Part of the Goodnight Kiwi series of direct addresses to the viewer specifically designed to be broadcast between the hours of 2-4am. Reflecting the often solitary and ritual nature of technological occupation, Goodnight Kiwi variously offers aesthetic transformation, mass media critique or moments of personal reflection arising from the effects of exhausted wakefulness.
description_for_label: Part of the Goodnight Kiwi series of direct addresses to the viewer specifically designed to be broadcast between the hours of 2-4am. results.title: Color
results.creator_credit: ACI Films and American Federation of Arts
results.brief_description: Examines colour for its emotional effects, influence on perception of size, shape and depth, and interaction with other colours. Explains how colour is essential to painting.
